content: An interview with Masih Alinejad, who started a campaign against compulsory hijab in Iran ![Should the veil be a matter for the courts or conscience?](https://cdn.static-economist.com/sites/default/files/20180811_BLP510.jpg) Masih Alinejad tells Anne McElvoy how she took My Stealthy Freedom, her viral campaign against compulsory hijab in Iran, from social media to the streets. They talk about the possibility of reform, the impact of visiting Western female politicians wearing the veil and why she believes Iranian women do not want to be liberated by the West.
